result.execSummary:
The defendant Javier Rosado was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 13 days if revoked.
No Huber privileges if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
**  Pay supervision fees.
  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program or Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
**  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
**  Pay restitution in the sum of $216.67 plus surcharges.
**  Added the 5% restitution surcharge now.
  May not have contact with any Menards Stores in the world, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Take medications as prescribed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Javier Rosado

records.addlTxt: Restitution stipulated to by the defendant and to be released forthwith.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Caley.  Clerk HMcBride.  Request for restitution in the amt of $216.67.  DE enters guilty plea.  Court imposes and stays 9 months jail; DE placed on probation for 1 year with conditions; 13 days credit if revoked; no Huber privileges if revoked; restitution ordered $216.67;   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.  Appeal rights given.
Final pre-trial on August 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Court reschedules time of 8/26 hearing to 9:30am.  Atty Caley notified by email this day.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
